message.content: Without seeing the actual figure provided in the question, it is difficult to determine the exact answer. However, we can make some assumptions based on the given information. The new drug is supposed to have a higher potency but the same efficacy as ibuprofen, with the hope of minimizing gastrointestinal side effects. This means that the new drug should be more effective at a lower dose than ibuprofen, but should have similar effectiveness overall. In terms of side effects, the new drug should ideally have fewer gastrointestinal side effects than ibuprofen. Curve A would represent a drug that has higher potency and similar efficacy as ibuprofen, which fits the scientists' specifications. Curve B may also have higher potency, but its overall efficacy is lower than ibuprofen, which does not meet the desired specifications. Curve C is ibuprofen itself and Curve D represents a drug that is less potent than ibuprofen and has lower efficacy, which is not what the scientists desire.

However, based on the given context, scientists are seeking a new non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug that has a higher potency and the same efficacy as ibuprofen to minimize gastrointestinal side effects. The desired therapeutic effect is represented by the dashed line Y. Curve C represents the potency and efficacy of ibuprofen. Therefore, the new drug needs to have a higher potency and the same efficacy as ibuprofen, which means its potency-efficacy curve needs to shift upwards and to the left. Based on this requirement, curve A would be the best representation of the new drug.
